subclusters.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of late-acting deleterious alleles due to declining natural selection with age, explaining senescence from an evolutionary perspective.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of late-acting deleterious mutations and age-dependent inbreeding depression consistent with evolutionary mutation accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes evolutionary accumulation of late-acting deleterious mutations due to weaker selection at older ages.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent accumulation of deleterious mutations and increasing genetic variance with age, fitting evolutionary mutation accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes spontaneous mutation accumulation affecting life history traits and increasing mutational variance over generations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mathematical modeling of declining force of natural selection with age leading to mutation accumulation and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: QTL studies showing late-acting deleterious mutations accumulate due to weak selection, consistent with evolutionary mutation accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates mutation accumulation and antagonistic pleiotropy models emphasizing evolutionary weakening of selection with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Classical evolutionary theory describing aging as a consequence of declining natural selection and life history trade-offs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Evolutionary senescence theory highlighting declining selection with age and life history trade-offs shaping aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Mutation Accumulation Theory of Senescence
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging as a byproduct of late-acting mutation accumulation shaped by extrinsic mortality and weak selection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic heterogeneity, allelic variation, and mapping of aging-related genes modulating mutation accumulation effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes longevity assurance genes modulating aging rate and mutation effects, linking genetics to mutation accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows genetic control of aging via age-1 gene mutation extending lifespan, illustrating genetic modulation of mutation accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Modern medicine reduces natural selection, allowing accumulation of deleterious cardiovascular disease genes, a genetic modulation of mutation accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Life history theory including genetic adaptation and plasticity affecting energy allocation and aging, modulating mutation accumulation effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mutation accumulation limits clonal lifespan in unicellular organisms, with genetic control and telomere involvement modulating effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation and Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Clonal expansion of mutant stem cells with proliferative advantage modulates aging, linking genetic mutation accumulation to systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stochastic accumulation of somatic mutations causing genomic instability and functional decline in aging tissues.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes increased spontaneous somatic mutations with age due to faulty DNA replication and repair enzymes causing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Somatic mutation theory emphasizing transposable element movement causing DNA damage and reduced lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Single-cell sequencing reveals accumulation of somatic mutations in functional genomic regions contributing to aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genome instability and transcriptional deregulation from somatic mutation accumulation cause stochastic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Somatic Mutation Accumulation and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: DNA damage accumulation and error-prone repair lead to somatic mutations and functional decline in aging.
